poem:
Title: "In the Shadows of Power"

Grey dawn breaks on a tale told,
The cricket king, fortunes once bold.
Corrupt leagues, veiled in the night,
Reflect in Punjab's sorrowful light.
A state's heart, sold then bought,
Silenced secrets, echoes fraught.
Her sari of guilt, entwined in threads,
Manacles echo in marital beds.
Sentenced in years, both equal and same,
Shadows of power, cast in Toshakhana's name.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Imran Khan, Pakistan former PM, sentenced to 14 years in prison for corruption Pakistan’s former prime minister Imran Khan has been sentenced to 14 years in jail in a corruption case, a day after he was given a 10-year sentence for leaking state secrets. Khan’s wife, Bushra Bibi, was also handed a 14-year sentence in the case, known as Toshakhana, which accused them both of illegally selling state gifts. The judge also banned them both". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
